actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on September 18, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick moved that the House do now adjourn
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1513.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1513 — "To direct the Federal Communications Commission to establish a task force to be known as the "6G Task Force", and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1648.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1648 — "To facilitate access to the electromagnetic spectrum for commercial space launches and commercial space reentries, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7858.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7858 — "To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to establish a Medicare incident to modifier for mental health services furnished through telehealth."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6033.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6033 — "To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a task force to improve access to health care information technology for non-English speakers."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 265.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 265 — "To reauthorize the rural emergency medical service training and equipment assistance program, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7406.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7406 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to carry out a program of research, training, and investigation related to Down syndrome, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4351.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4351 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize certain poison control programs."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6160.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6160 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize a lifespan respite care program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8084.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8084 — "To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to require States to verify certain eligibility criteria for individuals enrolled for medical assistance quarterly, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8089.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8089 — "To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to require certain additional provider screening under the Medicaid program."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7213.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7213 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to [enhance activities of the National Institutes of Health with respect to research on autism spectrum disorder and enhance programs relating to autism / reauthorize certain programs with respect to autism spectrum disorder?], and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8112.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8112 — "To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to further require certain additional provider screening under the Medicaid program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7218.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Miller-Meeks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7218 — "To amend title III of the Public Health Service Act to extend the program for promotion of public health knowledge and awareness of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4758.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Miller-Meeks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4758 — "To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to streamline enrollment under the Medicaid program of certain providers across State lines, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8111.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Miller-Meeks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8111 — "To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to ensure the reliability of address information provided under the Medicaid program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7208.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Miller-Meeks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7208 — "To reauthorize the Traumatic Brain Injury program."
The House observed a moment of silence in honor of a Texas Deputy Constable who lost his life in the line of duty.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 308
actions-list.actionItem: 87 (Roll no. 419).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 2861 — "To award a Congressional Gold Medal to Billie Jean King, an American icon, in recognition of a remarkable life devoted to championing equal rights for all, in sports and in society."

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 218
actions-list.actionItem: 181, 1 Present (Roll no. 418).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8314 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose penalties with respect to contributions to political committees from certain tax exempt organizations that receive contributions from foreign nationals."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9468.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Garcia, Mike moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9468 — "Making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2911.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2911 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to periodically review the automatic maximum coverage under the Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance program and the Veterans' Group Life Insurance program, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4190.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4190 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to repay the estates of deceased beneficiaries for certain benefits paid by the Secretary and misused by fiduciaries of such beneficiaries."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5464.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5464 — "To name the Department of Veterans Affairs community-based outpatient clinic in Guntersville, Alabama, as the "Colonel Ola Lee Mize Department of Veterans Affairs Clinic"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7816.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7816 — "To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to seek to enter into an agreement with a federally funded research and development center for an assessment of notice letters that the Secretary sends to claimants for benefits under laws administered by the Secretary, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7342.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7342 — "To establish the Veterans Advisory Committee on Equal Access, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4424.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4424 — "To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to study and report on the prevalence of cholangiocarcinoma in veterans who served in the Vietnam theater of operations during the Vietnam era, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7100.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7100 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify the organization of the Office of Survivors Assistance of the Department of Veterans Affairs."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7777.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7777 — "To increase, effective as of December 1, 2024, the rates of compensation for veterans with service-connected disabilities and the rates of dependency and indemnity compensation for the survivors of certain disabled veterans, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6324.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6324 — "To authorize major medical facility projects for the Department of Veterans Affairs for fiscal year 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3800.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3800 — "To codify Internal Revenue Service guidance relating to treatment of certain services and items for chronic conditions as meeting the preventive care deductible safe harbor for purposes of high deductible health plans in connection with health savings accounts."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1432.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1432 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the deductibility of charitable contributions to certain organizations for members of the Armed Forces."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8314.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8314 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose penalties with respect to contributions to political committees from certain tax exempt organizations that receive contributions from foreign nationals."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9076.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9076 — "To reauthorize and modernize part B of title IV of the Social Security Act to strengthen child welfare services, expand the availability of prevention services to better meet the needs of vulnerable families, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1146.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. S. 1146 — "To amend part E of title IV of the Social Security Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to identify obstacles to identifying and responding to reports of children missing from foster care and other vulnerable foster youth, to provide technical assistance relating to the removal of such obstacles, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3784.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3784 — "To amend title VII of the Social Security Act to provide for a single point of contact at the Social Security Administration for individuals who are victims of identity theft."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8292.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8292 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase penalties for unauthorized disclosure of taxpayer information."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5861.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5861 — "To extend reemployment services and eligibility assessments to all claimants for unemployment benefits, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2861.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2861 — "To award a Congressional Gold Medal to Billie Jean King, an American icon, in recognition of a remarkable life devoted to championing equal rights for all, in sports and in society."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2825.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2825 — "To award a Congressional Gold Medal to the United States Army Dustoff crews of the Vietnam War, collectively, in recognition of their extraordinary heroism and life-saving actions in Vietnam."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7438.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7438 — "To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint coins in commemoration of the FIFA World Cup 2026, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Ezell to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
